title: Jeremy Corbyn refuses to commit to immediate election if Boris Johnson secures Brexit extension
text:
Jeremy Corbyn has refused to commit to calling for an election immediately if Boris Johnson secures an extension from the EU.

He told members the Prime Minister he should "obey the law, take no deal off the table and then let's have the election".

"We're ready. There's only one reason it hasn't happened yet - we can't trust you," he said.

But asked whether he would commit to supporting a general election with a confidence motion immediately after an extension was granted by the EU, Mr Corbyn refused to answer.

At a speech to Labour members in Northampton, he said: "We are in for a few days of shadow boxing by Boris Johnson and a decision will hopefully come back to Parliament after the EU summit. ...
description: Jeremy Corbyn has refused to commit to calling for an election immediately if Boris Johnson secures an extension from the EU.
